column4: have tried gos as well, same problem :( what would the best ubuntu be for eeepc, if dhcp is disabled in the network?
id use xubuntu as its get a lower memeory footprint
the it is my broadband ;) ;) ;) the bottleneck ;)

eeexubuntu has the drivers for native wifi

I know, but thats why I am here for, the wifi works only if in my router dhcp is enabled, if I try manual config, it doesn'r work, while in xandros manual is no prob, so it cannot be missspell anything nor the hardware. lopin told me to patch it http://www.ubuntugeek.com/atheros-5007eg-with-madwifi-on-i386-platform.html and now while waiting I wanted to know, if I can verify to have the right hardware ;) thx again
